meal.name: Sweet Potato Curry
meal.meal_story: This vegetarian sweet potato curry is packed with flavor. We teamed up with our friend and spice master Lior of La Boite to create the curry blend for this dish. Roasted sweet potatoes and farm vegetables in a vibrant coconut curry served over lemongrass garlic Jasmine rice with a burst of fresh herbs on top.

ingredients_data.name: Blended Oil
ingredients_data.description: Most supermarket brands of olive oil are blended from oil from many different varieties, regions, and even countries. ... Sometimes olive oil is blended with canola or other vegetable oils.

ingredients_data.name: Cardamom
ingredients_data.description: ​Cardamom is related to ginger and can be used in much the same way to counteract digestive problems. Use it to combat nausea, acidity, bloating, gas, heartburn, loss of appetite, constipation, and much more. This spice helps the body eliminate waste through the kidneys.

ingredients_data.name: Cilantro
ingredients_data.description: Health benefits of cilantro leaves (coriander) Cilantro herb is very low in calories and contains no cholesterol. However, its deep-green leaves possess good amounts of antioxidants, essential oils, vitamins, and dietary fiber, which may help reduce LDL or "bad cholesterol" levels in the blood.

ingredients_data.name: Coconut Milk
ingredients_data.description: Coconut milk is a vegan, lactose-free, environmentally friendly beverage that can substitute dairy milk. It contains almost the same amount of protein per serving and has a creamy special savory taste that enriches every dish without adding any cholesterol. Calcium enriched options are great for vegans to help maintain bones and teeth healthy!

ingredients_data.name: Curry Powder
ingredients_data.description: Curry Powder is a popular spice mix that has a number of valuable health benefits, including the prevention of cancer, protection against heart disease, reduce Alzheimer's disease symptoms, ease pain and inflammation, boost bone health, protect the immune system from bacterial infections, and increase the liver's ...

ingredients_data.name: Garlic
ingredients_data.description: Known for its unique aroma and its strong, spicy flavor that mellows and sweetens with its cooking, garlic is one of the most popular ingredients in all cuisines. Some studies have shown that it has antibacterial and potential anticancer properties. Other investigations state that it may also help regulate blood pressure and make blood thinner, thus protecting the heart. So go ahead and spice up your life with garlic!

ingredients_data.name: Garlic Powder
ingredients_data.description: Known for its unique aroma and its strong, spicy flavor that mellows and sweetens with its cooking, garlic is one of the most popular ingredients in all cuisines. Some studies have shown that it has antibacterial and potential anticancer properties. Other investigations state that it may also help regulate blood pressure and make blood thinner, thus protecting the heart. So go ahead and spice up your life with garlic!

ingredients_data.name: Ginger
ingredients_data.description: Ginger has been a popular ingredient and herbal medicine for thousands of years in Asian, Indian, and Arabic herbal traditions. Fresh or dried, ginger´s spicy and strong taste brings life to your meals and also adds powerful benefits. Because of its gingerol, it can be used to prevent or treat nausea and vomiting from motion sickness, pregnancy, and in some cases cancer chemotherapy. It is also used to treat mild stomach upset, to reduce pain of osteoarthritis, and may even be used in heart disease and nasal allergies. Ongoing investigations suggest that it may help improve blood sugar control in type 2 diabetes. Ginger is rich in manganese, and has moderate amounts of magnesium and vitamin B6.

ingredients_data.name: Green Beans
ingredients_data.description: The fiber content is very high, and it also provides some of your daily protein requirements. They also act as an easy source for acquiring vitamins like A, C, K, B6, and folic acid. In terms of minerals, green beans are a good source of calcium, silicon, iron, manganese, potassium, and copper.

ingredients_data.name: Green Onion
ingredients_data.description: Scallions are vegetables of various Allium onion species. Scallions have a milder taste than most onions. Their close relatives include garlic, shallot, leek, chive, and Chinese onion.

ingredients_data.name: Green Zucchini
ingredients_data.description: The zucchini, or courgette is a summer squash, of Mesoamerican origin. In a culinary context, the zucchini is treated as a vegetable; it is usually cooked and presented as a savory dish or accompaniment. Botanically, zucchinis are fruits, a type of botanical berry called a "pepo", being the swollen ovary of the zucchini flower.

ingredients_data.name: Ground Black Pepper
ingredients_data.description: Because of its antibacterial properties, pepper is also used to preserve food. It is a rich source of manganese, iron, potassium, vitamin-C, vitamin K, and dietary fiber. Black pepper is also a very good anti-inflammatory agent.

ingredients_data.name: Heavy Cream
ingredients_data.description: Heavy cream is a healthy fat that helps keep your blood sugar stable between meals and snacks, which means consistent energy and brain power—not to mention it makes your coffee taste decadent!

ingredients_data.name: Jasmine Rice
ingredients_data.description: Although humans aren't able to digest fiber, it provides vital health benefits. Fiber, also known as roughage, helps lower and control blood sugar levels and blood cholesterol levels, and it also helps prevent constipation. Brown jasmine rice is packed with fiber

ingredients_data.name: Kaffir Lime Leaf
ingredients_data.description: Kaffir lime has pleasant flavor and uniquely tart which it gives to it specific place in the herbal medicine. People use leaves, fruit, rind and oil of the  for many different purposes. In Thai cooking kaffir lime is added in sauces and soups. The oil from kaffir lime is used in cosmetic products, shampoos, fragrances, salves and soaps. The leaves of kaffir lime are used in oral or topical way. When you have oil which is extracted from kaffir lime, then you should not consume it in direct way because it can lead to dizziness, nausea, lightheadedness and vomiting. You should mix the essential oil of kaffir leaves with water or with another type of diluting agent. These are the side effects of the kaffir lime which are known. You must talk with your doctor before you add kaffir lime in your diet because you do not know if this fruit will work properly for you. Here are some health benefits of the kaffir lime:

ingredients_data.name: Kosher Salt
ingredients_data.description: Also known as koshering salt, it is specially recognized because of its flake-like shape. Even though all three salts- sea, table and kosher- contain the same amount of sodium per gram, kosher salt yields less sodium per tablespoon because of its coarser grain. In other words, it enhances the flavor of each ingredient while protecting your heart from an excessive sodium intake!!

ingredients_data.name: Lemon Grass
ingredients_data.description: Lemongrass is a plant. The leaves and the oil are used to make medicine. Lemongrass is used for treating digestive tract spasms, stomachache, high blood pressure, convulsions, pain, vomiting, cough, achy joints (rheumatism), fever, the common cold, and exhaustion. It is also used to kill germs and as a mild astringent.

ingredients_data.name: Lime Juice
ingredients_data.description: Every time you drink a glass of lime juice, you not only quench your thirst, you also give your body a lot of health benefits. One of them is for your skin care, constipation, blood pressure control , respiratory problem... just to name a few.

ingredients_data.name: Mint
ingredients_data.description: The health benefits of mint include the following: Digestion: Mint is a great appetizer or palate cleanser, and it promotes digestion. It also soothes stomachs in cases of indigestion or inflammation. When you feel sick to your stomach, drinking a cup of mint tea can give you relief.

ingredients_data.name: Onion
ingredients_data.description: Red onions, also known as Spanish onions, contain plenty of healthy essential nutrients as well as phytochemicals that provide long-term health benefits. Including red onions in your daily diet may help reduce your risk of chronic disease.

ingredients_data.name: Onion Powder
ingredients_data.description: Onion powder is made from dehydrated onions, giving it a concentrated flavor that pairs well with many foods. Using onion powder when cooking offers health benefits because it contains some nutrients, but in small amounts, meaning you can't rely on it to meet your daily recommended totals.

ingredients_data.name: Red Bell Pepper
ingredients_data.description: Red bell peppers contain several phytochemicals and carotenoids, particularly beta-carotene, which lavish you with antioxidant and anti-inflammatory benefits. The capsaicin in bell peppers has multiple health benefits.

ingredients_data.name: Red Curry Paste
ingredients_data.description: Indian curry uses curry powder, a powder mix of coriander, turmeric, cumin, fenugreek, red pepper and other spices. Most Thai curry dishes use either a green or red curry paste in which the base is made up of red or green chili's, shallots, garlic, lemongrass, ginger and other fragrant herbs and spices

ingredients_data.name: Red Onion
ingredients_data.description: Organic onions contain fiber and folic acid, a B vitamin that helps the body make healthy new cells. Onions are healthy whether they're raw or cooked, though raw onions have higher levels of organic sulfur compounds that provide many benefits, according to the BBC.

ingredients_data.name: Sweet Potato
ingredients_data.description: Sweet potatoes are an excellent source of vitamin A (in the form of beta-carotene). They are also a very good source of vitamin C, manganese, copper, pantothenic acid and vitamin B6. Additionally, they are a good source of potassium, dietary fiber...

ingredients_data.name: Water
ingredients_data.description: Drinking Water Helps Maintain the Balance of Body Fluids. Your body is composed of about 60% water. The functions of these bodily fluids include digestion, absorption, circulation, creation of saliva, transportation of nutrients, and maintenance of body temperature.

ingredients_data.name: Yellow Onion
ingredients_data.description: The brown onion or yellow onion is a variety of dry onion with a strong flavour. They have a greenish-white, light yellow, or white inside, its layers of papery skin have a yellow-brown or pale golden colour. It is higher in sulphur content than the white onion, which gives it a stronger, more complex flavour.

cooking_steps.oven_steps:
1. Preheat to 350F.
2. Remove sleeve and film.
3. Heat up for 20 mins or until heated thoroughly.
cooking_steps.microwave_steps:
1. Remove sleeve and peel corner of
    film to vent.
2. Microwave for 5 mins. with medium
    heat. 
3. Remove film.
